Biography

Taylor Martin has played 30 games during her young Rutgers-Camden basketball career, averaging 3.4 points and 2.1 rebounds. She is shooting 29-for-112 (25.9 percent) on three-point attempts during her career.

Academics: New Jersey Athletic Conference Academic Honorable Mention for the 2020-21 scholastic year...Rutgers-Camden Athletic Director’s Honor Roll and Dean’s List student for the 2019 Fall, 2020 Spring, 2020 Fall and 2021 Spring semesters…One of 47 athletes on the 171-member 2020 Spring AD Honor Roll to post a perfect 4.0 GPA…One of 29 athletes on the 151-member 2020 Fall AD Honor Roll to post a perfect 4.0 GPA.

Basketball 2020-21: Played in five of the Scarlet Raptors’ six games during the brief pandemic-altered season, starting four…Averaged 4.6 points and 3.6 rebounds…Collected six assists and three steals…Shot 7-for-17 (.412) from three-point range…Scored her season high of nine points against The College of New Jersey (Feb. 13), shooting 3-for-4 from three-point range…Had a pair of five-rebound games, coming against Rutgers-Newark (Feb. 6) and Stockton (Feb. 19), to tie her career high.

Basketball 2019-20: Played in all 25 Rutgers-Camden games…Started eight games, including the last six of the season…Averaged 3.2 points and 1.8 rebounds…Dished off 18 assists, had 14 steals and added three blocked shots…Shot 22-for-95 from three-point range, tying for third on the team in three-point field goals…Made her collegiate debut in the season opener at Penn State-Schuylkill (Nov. 12), collecting two rebounds, two points and one assist in 24 minutes…Had four points, two steals, four rebounds and a career-high three assists against Penn State-Lehigh Valley (Nov. 15)…Scored in double figures for the first time at Cairn University (Nov. 16) when she went 4-for-6 from the floor, including 3-for-5 from three-point range, for 11 points, while adding three rebounds and one steal…Started her first game against Arcadia (Nov. 23), notching four rebounds and one steal…Had a huge game off the bench at Rowan (Nov. 26), shooting 7-for-11 from the floor, including 6-for-9 from three-point range, on her way to 20 points…Her six treys were the most by any Scarlet Raptor during the season and she also added two assists and one rebound in the game…Notched eight points, one assist, one steal and career highs of five rebounds and two blocked shots at Gallaudet (Dec. 1)…Started against Kean (Dec. 14) and collected two rebounds and two assists…In the Raptors’ second contest of the season against Kean (Feb. 1), made her third career start to begin a streak of six straight starts, which carried through the end of the season…Had nine points in back-to-back conference road games at Rutgers-Newark (Feb. 8) and at Ramapo (Feb. 12), shooting a combined 6-for-18 (.333) from three-point range…Added four rebounds against Ramapo.

High School: Captured four varsity letters in both basketball and softball at Maple Shade High School…Two-time All-Conference First Team…Two-time All-Conference Second Team…Two-time team captain…Two-time team Most Valuable Player…Four-time Scholar Athlete…Graduated in 2019.

Club Team: Baseline Hoops

Personal: Born February 21, 2001…Enjoys watching Philly sports and going to the beach…Health Sciences major at Rutgers-Camden who plans to become a Physician’s Assistant…Taylor is the daughter of Lisa and Ed Martin of Maple Shade.
